instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..
definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Mac air & baby sick?
threads.message:
Am I going mad or do these new air models not have the logic board number printed on them? 
All I could find is this... 
[ATTACH]60904[/ATTACH][ATTACH]60905[/ATTACH]

This lady just dropped this off telling me her 5 month old baby was sick on it. She said she cleaned it with baby wipes and now it won't come on! 
(IT FUCKING STINKS!) 

So it does turn on, with backlight but no image, I get a chime and it charges, tried external display and got one then it went off, then it came on again then I couldn't get one at all so give up for the night. 



Tried again today opened it up and it's immaculate inside, no liquid sensors triggered no sign of moisture at Al it looks like new both sides of the board. 

Then I tried external display again and it was on the user log in screen with it auto typing into the log in box.. Stuck key maybe?

I then notice that if I power it off holding the power button it just turns itself back on again. 

It also speaks to me and says "username" if I hit f12. 

So I'm guessing the keyboard / TP are liquid damaged and the logic board is OK? but question is would this prevent the screen form working? I get backlight nothing else. 

I'm thinking if this is a new screen keyboard and tp it's not an economical repair. Your advice appreciated

threads.title: Mac air & baby sick?
threads.message:
Check the model printed on the backcover.
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> -> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> -> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> -> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
Can also be M1 Air.

threads.title: Mac air & baby sick?
threads.message:
[IMG alt="20221218_202951.jpg"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/data/attachments/4/4058-5b821f8a177843a2d449e2072dd6331f.jpg[/IMG]
Its an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>

threads.title: Mac air & baby sick?
threads.message:
Looks like sticky key there.
Being T2 machine, it will auto power on if any key, or trackpad is pressed.
That's the reason doesn't stay off after holding power button.

threads.title: Mac air & baby sick?
threads.message: What about no screen just backlight. Would keyboard trackpad issue cause this or you think the screen is fucked to? Trying to establish if its worth attempting to repair this? I don't have any donor parts for this to even try them.

threads.title: Mac air & baby sick?
threads.message:
This looks like LCD issue.
You must test with known good compatible screen.
Broken one, where you can see small part of image, is good enough for diagnostic.
